ContentDescription_V1: Respond to music, expressing what they enjoy and why
Comment: Refined to focus more on the importance of music to people

ContentDescription_V1: Explore sound and silence and ways of using their voices, movement and instruments to express ideas
Comment: Refined, with a greater emphasis on play

ContentDescription_V1: Explore sound and silence and ways of using their voices, movement and instruments to express ideas
Comment: Refined with simpler language, and specifically linked to play

ContentDescription_V1: Sing and play instruments to create and practise chants, songs and rhymes including those used by cultural groups in the local community
Comment: Refined with a simpler statement about creating, to avoid repetition with Developing Practices strand

ContentDescription_V1: Rehearse and perform songs and short instrumental pieces which they have learnt and composed
Comment: Refined for clarity and leaves the ‘performance’ options more open

ContentDescription_V1: Respond to music, communicating their preferences and discussing where and why people in their local area make and perform music, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Reworded for accessibility

ContentDescription_V1: Sing and play instruments to improvise, compose and practise a repertoire of chants, songs and rhymes, including those used by cultural groups in the local community  Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed to communicate ideas to an audience (VCAMUP023)
Comment: Refined to more specifically articulate, in accessible language, the skills being developed

ContentDescription_V1: Sing and play instruments to improvise, compose and practise a repertoire of chants, songs and rhymes, including those used by cultural groups in the local community (VCAMUM022) Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed to communicate ideas to an audience
Comment: Refined to more specifically articulate, in accessible language, the skills being developed

ContentDescription_V1: Sing and play instruments to improvise, compose and practise a repertoire of chants, songs and rhymes, including those used by cultural groups in the local community  Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed to communicate ideas to an audience (VCAMUP023) Use imagination and experimentation to explore musical ideas using voice, movement, instruments and body percussion VCAMUE021)
Comment: Similar content, but incorporated into the Creating strand and making clear reference to elements

ContentDescription_V1: Sing and play instruments to improvise, compose and practise a repertoire of chants, songs and rhymes, including those used by cultural groups in the local community (VCAMUM022) Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed to communicate ideas to an audience  Use imagination and experimentation to explore musical ideas using voice, movement, instruments and body percussion VCAMUE021)
Comment: Similar content, but incorporated into the Creating strand and making clear reference to elements

ContentDescription_V1: Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed to communicate ideas to an audience
Comment: Refined

ContentDescription_V1: Identify features of the music they listen to, compose and perform, and discuss the purposes it was created for, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, using music terminology
Comment: Split into 2, but content is very similar

ContentDescription_V1: Identify features of the music they listen to, compose and perform, and discuss the purposes it was created for, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, using music terminology
Comment: Split into 2, but content is very similar

ContentDescription_V1: Use imagination and creativity to explore pitch, rhythm/time and form, dynamics and tempo using voice, movement and instruments
Comment: Refined to offer more scope for different situations

ContentDescription_V1: Use voice and instruments to sing, play and arrange music from different cultures, times and locations, and improvise and compose music in different forms  Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed, shaping elements of music to communicate ideas to an audience (VCAMUP027)
Comment: Reworded for clarity, with some content now in Presenting strand

ContentDescription_V1: Use voice and instruments to sing, play and arrange music from different cultures, times and locations, and improvise and compose music in different forms (VCAMUM026) Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed, shaping elements of music to communicate ideas to an audience
Comment: Reworded for clarity, with some content now in Presenting strand

ContentDescription_V1: Rehearse and perform songs and instrumental music they have learnt and composed, shaping elements of music to communicate ideas to an audience
Comment: Refined to be more accessible

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how aspects of the elements of music are combined to communicate ideas, concepts and feelings by comparing music from different cultures, times and locations, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples  Explore ways of combining the elements of music using listening skills, voice and a range of instruments, objects and electronically generated sounds to create effects (VCAMUE029)
Comment: Refined for clarity and accessibility. Less prescriptive

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how aspects of the elements of music are combined to communicate ideas, concepts and feelings by comparing music from different cultures, times and locations, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples (VCAMUR032) Explore ways of combining the elements of music using listening skills, voice and a range of instruments, objects and electronically generated sounds to create effects
Comment: Refined for clarity and accessibility. Less prescriptive

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how aspects of the elements of music are combined to communicate ideas, concepts and feelings by comparing music from different cultures, times and locations, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Refined to focus more on the aspect of continuation of culture

ContentDescription_V1: Develop and practise technical skills and use of expressive elements of music in singing, playing instruments, improvising, arranging and composing
Comment: No substantive change

ContentDescription_V1: Develop and practise technical skills and use of expressive elements of music in singing, playing instruments, improvising, arranging and composing  Rehearse and perform songs and music they have learnt, including their own compositions, combining aspects of the elements of music and using performance skills, to communicate ideas and intentions to an audience (VCAMUP031)
Comment: Realignment of strands and clearer language, but no appreciable change to content

ContentDescription_V1: Develop and practise technical skills and use of expressive elements of music in singing, playing instruments, improvising, arranging and composing (VCAMUM030) Rehearse and perform songs and music they have learnt, including their own compositions, combining aspects of the elements of music and using performance skills, to communicate ideas and intentions to an audience
Comment: Realignment of strands and clearer language, but no appreciable change to content

ContentDescription_V1: Rehearse and perform songs and music they have learnt, including their own compositions, combining aspects of the elements of music and using performance skills, to communicate ideas and intentions to an audience
Comment: Realigned strands, but no major change to content

ContentDescription_V1: Analyse composers’ use of the elements of music and stylistic features when listening to and interpreting music  Identify and connect specific features and purposes of music from contemporary and past times including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, to explore viewpoints and enrich their music making (VCAMUR039)
Comment: Refined to include music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander musicians

ContentDescription_V1: Analyse composers’ use of the elements of music and stylistic features when listening to and interpreting music (VCAMUR038) Identify and connect specific features and purposes of music from contemporary and past times including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, to explore viewpoints and enrich their music making
Comment: Refined to include music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander musicians

ContentDescription_V1: Identify and connect specific features and purposes of music from contemporary and past times including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, to explore viewpoints and enrich their music making
Comment: Refined to include specific reference to Indigenous Culture and Intellectual Property rights

ContentDescription_V1: Develop music ideas through improvisation, composition and performance, combining and manipulating the elements of music
Comment: New alignment of content to suit the new strands

ContentDescription_V1: Experiment with elements of music, in isolation and in combination, using listening skills, voice, instruments and technologies to find ways to create and manipulate effects
Comment: Realignment of strands and clearer content

ContentDescription_V1: Create, practise and rehearse music to develop listening, compositional and technical and expressive performance skills
Comment: Introduction of interpretation of styles into Creating strand

ContentDescription_V1: Develop music ideas through improvisation, composition and performance, combining and manipulating the elements of music  Structure compositions by combining and manipulating the elements of music and using notation (VCAMUM036)
Comment: Includes notation and documentation of process of composition, which is preparation for continuation to senior secondary

ContentDescription_V1: Develop music ideas through improvisation, composition and performance, combining and manipulating the elements of music (VCAMUE034) Structure compositions by combining and manipulating the elements of music and using notation
Comment: Includes notation and documentation of process of composition, which is preparation for continuation to senior secondary

ContentDescription_V1: Rehearse and perform to audiences in different settings and contexts, a range of music they have learnt or composed, using techniques and expression appropriate to style
Comment: Reworded for clarity

ContentDescription_V1: Evaluate a range of performances and compositions to inform and refine their own music making  Analyse a range of music from contemporary and past times, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to explore differing viewpoints, enrich their music making, and develop understanding of music practice in local, national and international contexts (VCAMUR046)
Comment: Refined to include a focus on development of personal voice, which continues to VCE Music studies

ContentDescription_V1: Evaluate a range of performances and compositions to inform and refine their own music making (VCAMUR045) Analyse a range of music from contemporary and past times, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to explore differing viewpoints, enrich their music making, and develop understanding of music practice in local, national and international contexts
Comment: Refined to include a focus on development of personal voice, which continues to VCE Music studies

ContentDescription_V1: Analyse a range of music from contemporary and past times, including the music of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to explore differing viewpoints, enrich their music making, and develop understanding of music practice in local, national and international contexts
Comment: Refined to focus on Australian identity

ContentDescription_V1: Create, practise and rehearse music to interpret a variety of performance repertoire with increasing technical and expressive skill and awareness of stylistic conventions
Comment: Refined to use new language to align more closely with VCE Music studies

ContentDescription_V1: Plan, develop, and notate compositions with an understanding of style and convention
Comment: Refined to specifically reflect on both others’ and own compositions. This is appropriate for pathway to VCE

ContentDescription_V1: Manipulate combinations of the elements of music in a range of styles, using technology and notation to communicate music ideas and intentions
Comment: Refined for clarity to better align interpreting music to the Creating strand

ContentDescription_V1: Manipulate combinations of the elements of music in a range of styles, using technology and notation to communicate music ideas and intentions  Improvise and arrange music, using aural awareness and technical skills to manipulate the elements of music to explore options for interpretation and developing music ideas (VCAMUE040) Plan, develop, and notate compositions with an understanding of style and convention (VCAMUM043)
Comment: Realignment of strands

ContentDescription_V1: Manipulate combinations of the elements of music in a range of styles, using technology and notation to communicate music ideas and intentions (VCAMUE041) Improvise and arrange music, using aural awareness and technical skills to manipulate the elements of music to explore options for interpretation and developing music ideas  Plan, develop, and notate compositions with an understanding of style and convention (VCAMUM043)
Comment: Realignment of strands

ContentDescription_V1: Manipulate combinations of the elements of music in a range of styles, using technology and notation to communicate music ideas and intentions (VCAMUE041) Improvise and arrange music, using aural awareness and technical skills to manipulate the elements of music to explore options for interpretation and developing music ideas (VCAMUE040) Plan, develop, and notate compositions with an understanding of style and convention
Comment: Realignment of strands

ContentDescription_V1: Perform music applying techniques and expression to interpret the composer’s use of the elements of music and compositional devices
Comment: Reworded for clarity and inclusion of performances to audience
